alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 9:10PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, northwestern Calhoun, central Lexington, northwestern Sumter, Richland and southern Kershaw Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 910 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cassatt to 8 miles southeast of Lugoff to near Fort Jackson to near Lexington. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Camden, Bishopville, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Shaw Air Base, McEntire Air Base, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge and Gaston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 43 and 91, and between mile markers 97 and 126. Interstate 26 between mile markers 102 and 127. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
